title: Does life run on logic? - Quora

response.answer_text: Quite certainly. Except that we don't understand the logic and often end up calling it as uncertainity. We must understand that Life itself is a logic. And how can something that is bounded by a logic would be illogical? We born, we feel, we laugh, we cry, we eat, we drink, we live, we die - Pretty much common for everyone and we know that these things will certainly happen in our life except the “when” factor and that decides our fate. There is no uncertainity in life. If something happens as we anticipate, then we call it as logical, if not, we call it as illogical. As simple as that. But that's not correct, right? Just because we don't understand something doesn't really have to be illogical. It's our ignorance that talks at those times. Just imagine, if we don't anticipate things, would anything seem logical at all? No, right? Everything will seem to be random. And what if everything happens as we anticipates? Everything will seem to be perfect. So apparently we will have to raise the actual question of “How good are we in the prediction factor?” Life is that.

Life runs on PATTERNS… and from patterns our so called logic gets developed. Human mind functions in a way that we tend to discover patterns in everything, sometimes even in places where there are no chances of finding. Patterns can be viewed differently by different persons and hence logics differ from person to person. For example, people can tend to develop a habit of waking up and doing a thing daily as their first thing of the day. They see a pattern that if they do the same thing, they have good days most of the day. And over time it becomes a logic for them. So in a way, life runs on the things we want it to run on !

Not all the time. But yes life does run on logic. For example: logic tells you that even at a job which you adore, you will have hard days. Being in a relationship even with person you love the most doesn’t necessarily makes your life easy. Logic at some point or the other dismantle your irrational, illogical and painful emotions and brings you to a state of awareness where you can acknowledge what is right and what is not.
